00035 uint8    check_sendok_flag[MAX_SOCK_NUM];

00038 uint8    socket(SOCKET s, uint8 protocol, uint16 port, uint16 flag)
00039 {
00040    IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_MR(s),(uint16)(protocol | flag)); // set Sn_MR with protocol & flag
00041    if (port != 0) IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_PORTR(s),port);
00042    else 
00043    {
00044       iinchip_source_port++;     // if don't set the source port, set local_port number.
00045       IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_PORTR(s),iinchip_source_port);
00046    }
00047    setSn_CR(s, Sn_CR_OPEN);      // open s-th SOCKET 
00048    
00049    check_sendok_flag[s] = 1;     // initialize the sendok flag.
00050    
00051    #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00052       printf("%d : Sn_MR=0x%04x,Sn_PORTR=0x%04x(%d),Sn_SSR=%04x\r\n",s,IINCHIP_READ(Sn_MR(s)),IINCHIP_READ(Sn_PORTR(s)),IINCHIP_READ(Sn_PORTR(s)),getSn_SSR(s));
00053    #endif
00054    return 1;   
00055 }
00056 
00057 void     close(SOCKET s)
00058 {
00059    // M_08082008 : It is fixed the problem that Sn_SSR cannot be changed a undefined value to the defined value.
00060    //              Refer to Errata of W5300
00061    //Check if the transmit data is remained or not.
00062    if( ((getSn_MR(s)& 0x0F) == Sn_MR_TCP) && (getSn_TX_FSR(s) != getIINCHIP_TxMAX(s)) ) 
00063    { 
00064       uint16 loop_cnt =0;
00065       while(getSn_TX_FSR(s) != getIINCHIP_TxMAX(s))
00066       {
00067          if(loop_cnt++ > 10)
00068          {
00069             uint8 destip[4];
00070             // M_11252008 : modify dest ip address
00071             //getSIPR(destip);
00072             destip[0] = 0;destip[1] = 0;destip[2] = 0;destip[3] = 1;
00073             socket(s,Sn_MR_UDP,0x3000,0);
00074             sendto(s,(uint8*)"x",1,destip,0x3000); // send the dummy data to an unknown destination(0.0.0.1).
00075             break; // M_11252008 : added break statement
00076          }
00077          wait_10ms(10);
00078       }
00079    };
00081    setSn_IR(s ,0x00FF);          // Clear the remained interrupt bits.
00082    setSn_CR(s ,Sn_CR_CLOSE);     // Close s-th SOCKET     
00083 }

00086 uint8    connect(SOCKET s, uint8 * addr, uint16 port)
00087 {
00088    if
00089    (
00090       ((addr[0] == 0xFF) && (addr[1] == 0xFF) && (addr[2] == 0xFF) && (addr[3] == 0xFF)) ||
00091       ((addr[0] == 0x00) && (addr[1] == 0x00) && (addr[2] == 0x00) && (addr[3] == 0x00)) ||
00092       (port == 0x00) 
00093    )
00094    {
00095       #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00096          printf("%d : Fail[invalid ip,port]\r\n",s);
00097       #endif
00098       return 0;
00099    }
00100    
00101    // set destination IP 
00102    IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_DIPR(s),((uint16)addr[0]<<8)+(uint16)addr[1]);
00103    IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_DIPR2(s),((uint16)addr[2]<<8)+(uint16)addr[3]);
00104    // set destination port number
00105    IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_DPORTR(s),port);
00106    
00107    // Connect
00108    setSn_CR(s,Sn_CR_CONNECT);
00109 
00110    return 1;   
00111 }
00112 
00113 void     disconnect(SOCKET s)
00114 {
00115    setSn_CR(s,Sn_CR_DISCON);     // Disconnect
00116 }

00118 uint8    listen(SOCKET s)
00119 {
00120    if (getSn_SSR(s) != SOCK_INIT)
00121    {
00122       #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00123          printf("%d : SOCKET is not created!\r\n",s);
00124       #endif
00125       return 0;
00126    }
00127 
00128    setSn_CR(s,Sn_CR_LISTEN);     // listen
00129    
00130    return 1;
00131 }

00133 uint32   send(SOCKET s, uint8 * buf, uint32 len)
00134 {
00135    uint8 status=0;
00136    uint32 ret=0;
00137    uint32 freesize=0;
00138    #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00139       uint32 loopcnt = 0;
00140 
00141       printf("%d : send()\r\n",s);
00142    #endif
00143    
00144    ret = len;
00145    if (len > getIINCHIP_TxMAX(s)) ret = getIINCHIP_TxMAX(s); // check size not to exceed MAX size.
00146    
00147    
00148 
00149    /*
00150     * \note if you want to use non blocking function, <b>"do{}while(freesize < ret)"</b> code block 
00151     * can be replaced with the below code. \n
00152     * \code 
00153     *       while((freesize = getSn_TX_FSR(s))==0); 
00154     *       ret = freesize;
00155     * \endcode
00156     */
00157    // -----------------------
00158    // NOTE : CODE BLOCK START
00159    do                                   
00160    {
00161       freesize = getSn_TX_FSR(s);
00162       status = getSn_SSR(s);
00163       #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00164          printf("%d : freesize=%ld\r\n",s,freesize);
00165          if(loopcnt++ > 0x0010000)
00166          { 
00167             printf("%d : freesize=%ld,status=%04x\r\n",s,freesize,status);
00168             printf("%d:Send Size=%08lx(%d)\r\n",s,ret,ret);
00169             printf("MR=%04x\r\n",*((vuint16*)MR));
00170             loopcnt = 0;
00171          }
00172       #endif
00173       if ((status != SOCK_ESTABLISHED) && (status != SOCK_CLOSE_WAIT)) return 0;
00174    } while (freesize < ret);
00175    // NOTE : CODE BLOCK END
00176    // ---------------------
00177    
00178    wiz_write_buf(s,buf,ret);                 // copy data
00179 
00180    #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00181       loopcnt=0;
00182    #endif   
00183    
00184    if(!check_sendok_flag[s])                 // if first send, skip.
00185    {
00186       while (!(getSn_IR(s) & Sn_IR_SENDOK))  // wait previous SEND command completion.
00187       {
00188       #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00189 
00190          if(loopcnt++ > 0x010000)
00191          {
00192             printf("%d:Sn_SSR(%04x)\r\n",s,status);
00193             printf("%d:Send Size=%08lx(%d)\r\n",s,ret,ret);
00194             printf("MR=%04x\r\n",*((vuint16*)MR));
00195             loopcnt = 0;
00196          }
00197       #endif
00198          if (getSn_SSR(s) == SOCK_CLOSED)    // check timeout or abnormal closed.
00199          {
00200             #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00201                printf("%d : Send Fail. SOCK_CLOSED.\r\n",s);
00202             #endif
00203             return 0;
00204          }
00205       }
00206       setSn_IR(s, Sn_IR_SENDOK);             // clear Sn_IR_SENDOK      
00207    }
00208    else check_sendok_flag[s] = 0;
00209    
00210    // send
00211    setSn_TX_WRSR(s,ret);   
00212    setSn_CR(s,Sn_CR_SEND);
00213    
00214    return ret;
00215 }

00217 uint32   recv(SOCKET s, uint8 * buf, uint32 len)
00218 {
00219    uint16 pack_size=0;
00220    
00221    #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00222       printf("%d : recv()\r\n",s);
00223    #endif
00224    
00225    if(IINCHIP_READ(Sn_MR(s)) & Sn_MR_ALIGN) 
00226    {
00227       wiz_read_buf(s, buf, (uint32)len);
00228       setSn_CR(s,Sn_CR_RECV);
00229       return len;
00230    }
00231    
00232 
00233    wiz_read_buf(s,(uint8*)&pack_size,2);        // extract the PACKET-INFO(DATA packet length)
00234    if( (*(vint16*)MR) & MR_FS )
00235       pack_size = ((((pack_size << 8 ) & 0xFF00)) | ((pack_size >> 8)& 0x00FF));
00236    
00237    #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__   
00238       printf("%d:pack_size=%d\r\n",s,pack_size);
00239    #endif
00240 
00241    wiz_read_buf(s, buf, (uint32)pack_size);     // copy data   
00242    
00243    setSn_CR(s,Sn_CR_RECV);                      // recv
00244    
00245    /*
00246    * \warning  send a packet for updating window size. This code block must be only used when W5300 do only receiving data.
00247    */
00248    // ------------------------
00249    // WARNING CODE BLOCK START 
00250    
00251    // M_15052008 : Replace Sn_CR_SEND with Sn_CR_SEND_KEEP.
00252    //if(!(getSn_IR(s) & Sn_IR_SENDOK))
00253    //{
00254    //   setSn_TX_WRSR(s,0);                    // size = 0
00255    //   setSn_CR(s,Sn_CR_SEND);                // send
00256    //   while(!(getSn_IR(s) & Sn_IR_SENDOK));  // wait SEND command completion
00257    //   setSn_IR(s,Sn_IR_SENDOK);              // clear Sn_IR_SENDOK bit
00258    //}
00259    
00260    // M_04072008 : Replace Sn_CR_SEND_KEEP with Sn_CR_SEND.
00261    //if(getSn_RX_RSR(s) == 0)                     // send the window-update packet when the window size is full
00262    //{
00263    //   uint8 keep_time = 0;
00264    //   if((keep_time=getSn_KPALVTR(s)) != 0x00) setSn_KPALVTR(s,0x00); // disables the auto-keep-alive-process
00265    //   setSn_CR(s,Sn_CR_SEND_KEEP);              // send a keep-alive packet by command
00266    //   setSn_KPALVTR(s,keep_time);               // restore the previous keep-alive-timer value
00267    //}
00268    if(getSn_RX_RSR(s) == 0)                     // check if the window size is full or not
00269    { /* Sn_RX_RSR can be compared with another value instead of ¡®0¡¯,
00270       according to the host performance of receiving data */
00271       setSn_TX_WRSR(s,1);                       // size : 1 byte dummy size
00272       IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_TX_FIFOR(s),0x0000);     // write dummy data into tx memory
00273       setSn_CR(s,Sn_CR_SEND);                   // send                         
00274       while(!(getSn_IR(s) & Sn_IR_SENDOK));     // wait SEND command completion 
00275       setSn_IR(s,Sn_IR_SENDOK);                 // clear Sn_IR_SENDOK bit       
00276    }                                                                         
00277 
00278    // WARNING CODE BLOCK END
00279    // ----------------------
00280    
00281    return (uint32)pack_size;
00282 }
00283 
00284 uint32   sendto(SOCKET s, uint8 * buf, uint32 len, uint8 * addr, uint16 port)
00285 {
00286    uint8 status=0;
00287    uint8 isr=0;
00288    uint32 ret=0;
00289    
00290    #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00291       printf("%d : sendto():%d.%d.%d.%d(%d), len=%d\r\n",s, addr[0], addr[1], addr[2], addr[3] , port, len);
00292    #endif
00293       
00294    if
00295    (
00296       ((addr[0] == 0x00) && (addr[1] == 0x00) && (addr[2] == 0x00) && (addr[3] == 0x00)) ||
00297       ((port == 0x00)) ||(len == 0)
00298    ) 
00299    {
00300       #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00301          printf("%d : Fail[%d.%d.%d.%d, %.d, %d]\r\n",s, addr[0], addr[1], addr[2], addr[3] , port, len);
00302       #endif
00303       return 0;
00304    }
00305    
00306    
00307    if (len > getIINCHIP_TxMAX(s)) ret = getIINCHIP_TxMAX(s); // check size not to exceed MAX size.
00308    else ret = len;
00309    
00310    // set destination IP address
00311    IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_DIPR(s),(((uint16)addr[0])<<8) + (uint16) addr[1]);
00312    IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_DIPR2(s),(((uint16)addr[2])<<8) + (uint16) addr[3]);
00313    // set destination port number
00314    IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_DPORTR(s),port);
00315    
00316    wiz_write_buf(s, buf, ret);                              // copy data
00317    // send
00318    setSn_TX_WRSR(s,ret);
00319    setSn_CR(s, Sn_CR_SEND);
00320    
00321    while (!((isr = getSn_IR(s)) & Sn_IR_SENDOK))            // wait SEND command completion
00322    {
00323       status = getSn_SSR(s);                                // warning ---------------------------------------
00324       if ((status == SOCK_CLOSED) || (isr & Sn_IR_TIMEOUT)) // Sn_IR_TIMEOUT causes the decrement of Sn_TX_FSR
00325       {                                                     // -----------------------------------------------
00326          #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00327             printf("%d: send fail.status=0x%02x,isr=%02x\r\n",status,isr);
00328          #endif
00329          setSn_IR(s,Sn_IR_TIMEOUT);
00330          return 0;
00331       }
00332    }
00333    setSn_IR(s, Sn_IR_SENDOK); // Clear Sn_IR_SENDOK
00334    
00335    #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__           
00336       printf("%d : send()end\r\n",s);
00337    #endif       
00338    
00339    return ret;   
00340 }
00341 
00342 uint32   recvfrom(SOCKET s, uint8 * buf, uint32 len, uint8 * addr, uint16  *port)
00343 {
00344    uint16 head[4];
00345    uint32 data_len=0;
00346    uint16 crc[2];
00347    
00348    #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00349       printf("recvfrom()\r\n");
00350    #endif
00351    
00352    if ( len > 0 )
00353    {
00354       switch (IINCHIP_READ(Sn_MR(s)) & 0x07)       // check the mode of s-th SOCKET
00355       {                                            // -----------------------------
00356          case Sn_MR_UDP :                          // UDP mode 
00357             wiz_read_buf(s, (uint8*)head, 8);      // extract the PACKET-INFO
00358             // read peer's IP address, port number.
00359             if(*((vuint16*)MR) & MR_FS)            // check FIFO swap bit
00360             {
00361                head[0] = ((((head[0] << 8 ) & 0xFF00)) | ((head[0] >> 8)& 0x00FF));
00362                head[1] = ((((head[1] << 8 ) & 0xFF00)) | ((head[1] >> 8)& 0x00FF));
00363                head[2] = ((((head[2] << 8 ) & 0xFF00)) | ((head[2] >> 8)& 0x00FF));
00364                head[3] = ((((head[3] << 8 ) & 0xFF00)) | ((head[3] >> 8)& 0x00FF));
00365             }
00366             addr[0] = (uint8)(head[0] >> 8);       // destination IP address
00367             addr[1] = (uint8)head[0];
00368             addr[2] = (uint8)(head[1]>>8);
00369             addr[3] = (uint8)head[1];
00370             *port = head[2];                       // destination port number
00371             data_len = (uint32)head[3];            // DATA packet length
00372             
00373             #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00374                printf("UDP msg arrived:%d(0x%04x)\r\n",data_len,data_len);
00375                printf("source Port : %d\r\n", *port);
00376                printf("source IP : %d.%d.%d.%d\r\n", addr[0], addr[1], addr[2], addr[3]);
00377             #endif
00378    
00379             wiz_read_buf(s, buf, data_len);        // data copy.
00380             break;
00381                                                    // -----------------------
00382          case Sn_MR_IPRAW :                        // IPRAW mode
00383             wiz_read_buf(s, (uint8*)head, 6);      // extract the PACKET-INFO 
00384             if(*((vuint16*)MR) & MR_FS)            // check FIFO swap bit
00385             {
00386                head[0] = ((((head[0] << 8 ) & 0xFF00)) | ((head[0] >> 8)& 0x00FF));
00387                head[1] = ((((head[1] << 8 ) & 0xFF00)) | ((head[1] >> 8)& 0x00FF));
00388                head[2] = ((((head[2] << 8 ) & 0xFF00)) | ((head[2] >> 8)& 0x00FF));
00389             }                           
00390             addr[0] = (uint8)(head[0] >> 8);       // destination IP address
00391             addr[1] = (uint8)head[0];
00392             addr[2] = (uint8)(head[1]>>8);
00393             addr[3] = (uint8)head[1];
00394             data_len = (uint32)head[2];            // DATA packet length
00395             
00396             #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00397                printf("IP RAW msg arrived\r\n");
00398                printf("source IP : %d.%d.%d.%d\r\n", addr[0], addr[1], addr[2], addr[3]);
00399             #endif
00400             
00401             wiz_read_buf(s, buf, data_len);        // data copy.
00402             break;                                 
00403                                                    // -----------------------
00404          case Sn_MR_MACRAW :                       // MACRAW mode
00405             wiz_read_buf(s,(uint8*)head,2);        // extract the PACKET-INFO
00406             if(*((vuint16*)MR) & MR_FS)            // check FIFO swap bit
00407                head[0] = ((((head[0] << 8 ) & 0xFF00)) | ((head[0] >> 8)& 0x00FF));
00408             data_len = (uint32)head[0];            // DATA packet length
00409             wiz_read_buf(s, buf, data_len);        // data copy.
00410             wiz_read_buf(s,(uint8*)crc, 4);        // extract CRC data and ignore it.
00411 
00412             break;
00413          default :
00414             break;
00415       }
00416       setSn_CR(s,Sn_CR_RECV);                      // recv
00417    }
00418    #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00419       printf("recvfrom() end ..\r\n");
00420    #endif
00421    
00422    return data_len;   
00423 }
